tags.name: Finance Api
tags.description:
Finance API Overview

This API is built to allow users to automate the transfer of data between the FranConnect system’s Finance module and their 3rd party Finance/ POS systems. FranConnect’s APIs are RESTful in nature and support the transfer Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete (CRUD) operations.

Rate limits and accounts

Currently, FranConnect’s REST APIs do not impose any rate limit restrictions but users are expected to retrieve data after certain interval and retrieve only the deltas (wherever applicable) so as to not overload the system. Retrieving a large dataset might result in slowness and impede the overall system performance.

Concurrent Requests

Franconnect’s APIs do not support concurrent requests and the API expects that the requests be served one at a time.

Authentication

FranConnect supports OAuth 2.0 for authenticating requests before they can be used to perform CRUD operations using FranConnect’s API. Further details on how to set up the authentication and generate the access token can be found here.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description:
Authentication

Authentication in the REST API for Finance happens using OAuth 2.0 with grant type as “password”. In order to generate an access token, the user has to have a valid FCSky login credential. The subsequent steps are as below:

  1. The user has to make a “POST” type request to https://auth.franconnectqa.net/userauth/oauth/token with “Authorization” set as “Basic Auth” with “client_id” and “client_secret” being “fcsky” and “fcskysecret”. This is common for all customers.

  2. Along with this, the user has to mention “Content-Type” as “application/json” (or “application/xml) and “X-TenantId” as the user’s FranConnect system’s login URL prior to “/fc”. This means that in case the user’s FranConnect system’s URL is “abc.franconnect.net/fc”, the “X-TenantId” would be “abc.franconnect.net” (without the double quotes).

  3. In the body of the request, the user has to fill in his/ her username and password in the “username” and “password” fields and has to specify the “grant_type” as “password”.

This request is to be posted as “form-data” on the https://auth.franconnectqa.net/userauth/oauth/token URL to generate an access token.

tags.name: Retrieve Franchise Number
tags.description:
Franchise ID, mentioned in various endpoints, refers to the franchise number against which any type of Create, Retrieve, Update, or Delete (hereafter to be referred as CRUD) operation is to be performed.

This can be found from “Admin > Manage Franchise Location” and then by clicking on the “modify” option from the action menu corresponding to the franchise location for which the sales categories are being retrieved.

Note: The franchisee numbers are immutable and there can only be one franchise number corresponding to a franchise location. It is, therefore, a one-time activity to retrieve the franchise number for each location and the franchise number thus retrieved can be used in subsequent operations.

get.description:
This represents the financial or the income categories that are used as a part of the sales report.

Operations:
Retrieve:

The retrieve operation is used to retrieve the financial categories that were used in a particular sales report.

Endpoint: /manage-finance/categories/sales/franchiseeID/{id}/reportPeriod/{reportPeriod}

Operation Name: Get

A previous section already talks about how to retrieve the report periods for which a location is yet to report sales for. This can be accessed here. Once this is done, a particular report period is to be selected and used in the endpoint to perform a GET operation. This would provide a list of financial categories that are available to report the sales against for the given report period.

This represents the non-financial or the KPI categories that are used as a part of the sales report.

Operations:
Retrieve:

The retrieve operation is used to retrieve the non-financial/ KPI categories that were used in a particular sales report.

Endpoint: /manage-finance/categories/kpis/franchiseeID/{id}/reportPeriod/{reportPeriod}

Operation Name: Get

A previous section already talks about how to retrieve the report periods for which a location is yet to report sales for. This can be accessed here. Once this is done, a particular report period selected, and the financial categories corresponding to that report period retrieved (click here to know more on how to retrieve financial categories in a particular report period), the next step is to perform a GET operation on the corresponding endpoint (mentioned above) to retrieve a list of non-financial/ KPI categories that are available for the given report period.

Note: Some of the clients may or may not have non-financial/ KPI categories set up in their sales report. In case the sales reports do not contain non-financial/ KPI categories, this step can be omitted.

This represents the additional items apart from the financial and the non-financial/KPI categories that the franchisor would like to include in their sales reports.

Operations:
Retrieve:

The retrieve operation is used to retrieve the additional invoice items that were used in a particular sales report.

Endpoint: /manage-finance/categories/addtional-items/franchiseeID/{id}/reportPeriod/{reportPeriod}

Operation Name: Get

Similar to non-financial/KPI categories, the “additional invoice items” are optional. While they can be configured from “Admin > Finance > Configure Additional Invoice Item(s)”, some franchisors have it configured as part of their sales reports while some choose not to. In case it is not configured, retrieving “additional invoice items” would result in an empty data set and can therefore be omitted, in such cases.

These are used to represent the categories that are present in P&L statements against which income and expenses are to be entered for each franchisee, on a monthly basis.

Operations:
Retrieve:

The retrieve operation is used to retrieve the non-financial/ KPI categories that were used in a particular sales report.

Endpoint: /manage-finance/categories/profit-loss

Operation Name: Get

Once a GET call is made to the endpoint mentioned above, the response contains all the P&L categories that are configured in the system and a placeholder where the “amount” can be filled in against that corresponding category.

post.description:
This operation is used to create a new P&L statement in the system.

Endpoint: /manage-finance/profit-loss

Operation Name: POST

Prior to creating a P&L statement using the REST API, the user must have:

  1. a valid access token. Steps on how an access token is to be generated is mentioned here.

  2. retrieved the P&L categories. Steps on how the P&L categories are retrieved is mentioned here.


A POST request is to be made to the endpoint specified above with “Content-Type” as “application/json”, “Authorization” as “bearer <<accessToken>>” (where the <<accessToken>> is to be replaced by the actual access token generated in step a), and “X-TenantId” as the login URL of the user’s FranConnect system prior to”/fc”.

The body of the request should be in the format as shown below:

[

{

"data":[

{

"franchiseeNo": "1196202994",

"statementPeriod": "Apr - 2019",

"submissionDate": "2019-05-31",

"plItems": [

{

P&L categories and their values

}

]

 

}]

}

]


In case the create operation is successful, the response data would contain the “plrepId”. This represents the internal reference ID for the P&L statement that was just created and can be used for retrieve and update operations.

The retrieve operation is used to retrieve an existing P&L statement. For this, the user must have:

  1. a valid access token. Steps on how an access token is to be generated is mentioned here.

  2. a valid report period for which the P&L statement is to be retrieved. Steps on how P&L report periods (a.k.a, statement period) is retrieved is mentioned here.


Endpoint: /manage-finance/profit-loss/filter

Operation Name: POST


Once the access token and P&L report period are retrieved, a POST request is to be made to the above endpoint with “Content-Type” as “application/json”, “Authorization” as “bearer <<accessToken>>” (where the <<accessToken>> is to be replaced by the actual access token generated), and “X-TenantId” as the login URL of the user’s FranConnect system prior to”/fc”.

The body of the request should be in the format as shown below:


{

"constraints": {

"statementPeriod":

{

"clause": "EQUAL",

"values": ["Feb - 2019"]

}

}}

post.description:
Royalty reports are generated on the basis of sales submitted for the locations and can be retrieved in a similar way as retrieving a sales report.

Endpoint: /manage-finance/royalties/filter

Operation Name: POST

Prior to retrieving royalty reports, the user should have:

  1. a valid access token. Access tokens, once generated, are valid for 12 hours. Click here to know how access tokens are generated.

  2. the invoice ID (“invoiceNo”) of the royalty report for which data is to be retrieved.

A POST request is to be made to the above endpoint with “Content-Type” as “application/json”, “Authorization” as “bearer <<accessToken>>” (where the <<accessToken>> is to be replaced by the actual access token generated), and “X-TenantId” as the login URL of the user’s FranConnect system prior to”/fc”.

The body of the request should be in the format as shown below:

{

"constraints":{

"invoiceNo":{

"clause": "EQUAL",

"values": "207"

}

}

}

Sales report can be created for a location for a given period for which the sales has not been filled yet. In order to do so, the following steps are to be performed prior to creating the sales report:

  1. Authenticate the user and generate an access token.

  2. Retrieve the franchise number. Details on how this is done is mentioned here.

  3. Retrieve the report periods for which the said location is yet to report sales for. Detailed steps are mentioned here.

  4. Retrieve the various financial categories, the non-financial/ KPI categories, and the additional invoice items.


Once the franchise number, the report period, and the various categories for Sales report are determined, the next step is to use this information to create a sales report.

Endpoint: /manage-finance/sales

Operation Name: POST

A POST request is to be made to the endpoint specified above with “Content-Type” as “application/json”, “Authorization” as “bearer <<accessToken>>” (where the <<accessToken>> is to be replaced by the actual access token generated in step a), and “X-TenantId” as the login URL of the user’s FranConnect system prior to”/fc”.

The body of the request should be in the format as shown below:

[

{

"data": [

{

"franchiseeNo": "1196202994",

"reportPeriod": "2019-05-26",

"dateReceived": "2019-05-31",

"financialItems": [

{

Financial categories, quantity, and amount

}

],

"nonFinancialItems": [

{

Non-Financial categories and their values

}

],

"finAddnlItems": [

{

Additional Invoice items and their values

}

]

}]

}]


The response provides “franchiseRoyaltyID” and “salesReportID”.

The retrieve operation is performed to retrieve an existing sales report for a given franchise location. In order for an existing sales report to be retrieved:

  1. User must have a valid access token.

  2. The user is to determine the franchise number of the location for which the report is to be retrieved.

  3. The report period is expressed in “YYYY-MM-DD” format and is used in the API endpoints without the double quotes.


Endpoint: /manage-finance/sales/filter

Operation Name: POST

A POST type of request is to be made to the endpoint mentioned above with “Content-Type” as “application/json”, “Authorization” as “bearer <<accessToken>>” (where the <<accessToken>> is to be replaced by the actual access token generated in step a), and “X-TenantId” as the login URL of the user’s FranConnect system prior to”/fc”.

The body of the request should be in the format as shown below:


{

"constraints": {

"reportNo": {

"clause": "EQUAL",

"values": ["202"]

}

}

}

Note: In the above example, the value that was used for “constraints” is "reportNo". Other acceptable values of constraints, that can be used to filter and retrieve sales reports, include salesReportID, reportPeriodStart, reportPeriodEnd, franchiseeNo, reportSubmitDate, totalSales, reportType filters. put.description:
The update operation is performed to update an existing sales report for a given franchise location. In order for an existing sales report to be updated:

  1. User must have a valid access token.

  2. User must have the salesReportID. The salesReportID can be retrieved by passing the “Report ID” as seen in the UI side (or any other Sales Report attribute) as a constraint in the retrieve operation as shown here. The salesReportID is also available in the response of a Create Sales Report Operation.


Endpoint: /manage-finance/sales/{id}

Operation Name: PUT


The body of the request should be in the format as shown below:

[

{

"data": [

{

"dateReceived": "2019-05-31",

"financialItems": [

{

Financial categories, modified quantity and/ or amount

}

],

"nonFinancialItems": [

{

Non-Financial categories and their modified values

}

],

"finAddnlItems": [

{

Additional Invoice items and their modified values

}

]

}]

}]


Note: It is to be noted that the sales report can only be modified as long as it is not approved. Once it is approved, only adjustments can be made to the sales report.

get.description:
The report period for Sales refers to the minimum period of time for which sales is to be reported by the franchise. The report period for any franchise location is defined in the financial agreement version that is associated with that franchise location. The term “report period” refers to the last day (i.e., the end date) of that reporting cycle.

Operations:
Retrieve:

The retrieve operation is used to retrieve all the report periods (i.e., the report period end dates) for which sales has not been reported by the franchise location.

Endpoint: /manage-finance/sales/periods/franchisee/{id}

Operation Name: Get

The franchise ID refers to the franchise number and can be retrieved from here. Once the franchise number has been retrieved, a GET operation needs to be performed on the endpoint mentioned above. This would provide a list of report periods for which the mentioned franchise is yet to report sales for.

The report period for Profit and Loss is the statement period for which Profit and Loss (hereafter being referred as P&L) records are consolidated. The P&L consolidation is done at the monthly level for each franchise location.

Operations:
Retrieve:

The retrieve operation is used to retrieve all the statement periods (i.e., the report period end dates) for which sales has not been reported by the franchise location.

Endpoint: /manage-finance/profit-loss/periods/franchisee/{id}

Operation Name: Get

The franchise ID refers to the franchise number and can be retrieved from here. Once the franchise number has been retrieved, a GET operation needs to be performed on the endpoint mentioned above. This would provide a list of statement periods for which the mentioned franchise is yet to declare its P&L statement for.
